backend_llm_notes: GPT-5 via Microsoft SilverFlow LLM API - Real API calls
original_prompt: Track all my important meetings and flag any that require focus time to prepare for them.

gutts.name: Access Calendar Data
gutts.capability: Retrieve user's calendar events from connected sources
gutts.user_goal: Enable the system to read all scheduled meetings
gutts.evidence: Successfully fetching event objects from Google Calendar API

gutts.name: Identify Important Meetings
gutts.capability: Determine which meetings are marked as important based on user-defined criteria or metadata
gutts.user_goal: Filter out only the meetings that are considered important
gutts.evidence: Applying importance rules and returning a subset of events labeled as important

gutts.name: Extract Meeting Metadata
gutts.capability: Parse and extract meeting details such as title, participants, and agenda
gutts.user_goal: Obtain detailed information about each important meeting
gutts.evidence: Structured JSON object containing meeting title, participants, and description

gutts.name: Analyze Preparation Needs
gutts.capability: Analyze meeting details to determine if preparation or focus time is required
gutts.user_goal: Identify which meetings require additional preparation
gutts.evidence: Classification result indicating whether a meeting requires prep time

gutts.name: Flag Meetings Requiring Focus Time
gutts.capability: Mark meetings that require preparation with a specific flag or label
gutts.user_goal: Visually or programmatically indicate meetings that need focus time
gutts.evidence: Meeting entries updated with a 'Focus Required' label in the calendar system

gutts.name: Track Important Meetings
gutts.capability: Maintain an up-to-date list or log of all important meetings for user reference
gutts.user_goal: Have a consolidated view of all important meetings
gutts.evidence: Persistent data structure listing all important meetings with timestamps
